newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania doubles bank minimum capital requirements.
newsitem.headline: Romania doubles bank minimum capital requirements.

text.p: Romania's central bank BNR said on Wednesday it had decided to double minimum capital requirements to win a commercial bank licence to 50 billion lei to put Romanian banks in line with European standards.
"The BNR board approved the new norms, which are meant to bring capital requirements in line with standards in the European Union," BNR official Mugur Stet told Reuters.
He said the norms had yet to be published in Romania's official gazette before coming into force.
Romanian licensed commercial banks operating on a smaller capital would have to bring their capital base to the 50 billion lei level before the end of 1998.
Capital requirements under the new norms concern 30 Romanian fully-licensed commercial banks and do not apply to nine foreign bank branches operating in Romania, Stet said.
